result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Jeremiah Jacob Hampton.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains on for trial.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Jeremiah Jacob Hampton.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial. Defense requested one more final pretrial to allow time to communicate with defendant. Jury Trial remains calendared for November 7, 2022 at 8:30 am. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion to Admit 911 Call received and filed.  bm
State's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm
State's Witness List received and filed.  bm

Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Jeremiah Jacob Hampton.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has received discovery, offer and requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton in court, appear by video with attorney Brett Lee Copeland, appear by video.  Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to case 21CF622. Sworn for the State: Deputy Blanchar.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jimmatta P or her children HGP or JAP, or Washington Park.

Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Jeremiah Jacob Hampton in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeremiah Jacob Hampton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY, on behalf of defendant, as to misdemeanor count 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
